The 'H-II Transfer Vehicle' ('HTV'), also called , is an unmanned resupply
spacecraft used to resupply the ''KibÅ'' Japanese Experiment Module (JEM) and
the International Space Station (ISS). The Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency
(JAXA) has been working on the design since the early 1990s. The first mission,
HTV-1, was originally intended to be launched in 2001. It launched at 17:01 UTC
on 10 September 2009 on an H-IIB launch vehicle. The name Kounotori
was chosen for the HTV by JAXA because "a white stork carries an image of
conveying an important thing (a baby, happiness, and other joyful things),
therefore, it precisely expresses the HTV's mission to transport essential
materials to the ISS".
categories: Supply vehicles for the International Space Station
